intro: Convolvulus sagittatus var. phyllosepalus, commonly known as the arrowhead morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of violet or blue. The plant is a climbing vine with tendrils that allow it to ascend supports or other structures. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for gardens and natural landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its rapid growth and showy blooms that attract pollinators.
